repetitions.exitCondition: uncontrolled adverse events or dose adjustment
repetitions.sourceText: off-site phone visits every other cycle for subjects who have been receiving single-agent veliparib/placebo at a stable dose without adjustment for multiple cycles without uncontrolled adverse events
Update tumor assessment schedule from every 9 weeks
allow every 12 weeks (or at longer intervals not to exceed 24 weeks per the investigator's discretion) from the prior scan
remove the requirement of tumor assessment at Final Visit in subjects without a tumor assessment within 4 weeks

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'If subject discontinues carboplatin and paclitaxel without progression', 'path': ['VELIPARIB_PLACEBO_SINGLE_AGENT_MONOTHERAPY']}, {'condition': 'If subject discontinues all study drugs for reasons other than progression', 'path': ['ON_STUDY_OFF_DRUG_MONITORING', 'TUMOR_ASSESSMENT']}, {'condition': 'If subject randomized to placebo experiences PD', 'path': ['UNBLINDING', 'CROSSOVER_OPEN_LABEL_VELIPARIB_MONOTHERAPY']}]

executionTypes.rationale: Scheduled to occur every other cycle for subjects on stable doses of single-agent veliparib/placebo.
Scheduled at regular intervals (every 9 to 12 weeks, or up to 24 weeks) throughout the study.

executionTypes.activityId: Hematologic blood counts for chemotherapy initiation
executionTypes.rationale: Conditional workflow where chemotherapy begins based on specific blood count thresholds/guidelines.

executionTypes.activityId: Adverse Event reporting (MDS, AML, or secondary primary malignancy)
executionTypes.rationale: Continuous monitoring and reporting required over a specific time period, including delayed onset monitoring.
Repeated assessments for all subjects who have discontinued therapy to monitor survival status.
A one-time event that occurred on 03 June 2019 for the sponsor.
Scheduled safety monitoring performed at the site level throughout the study duration.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Progression-free Survival (PFS)

timeWindow.duration: Until progression or death; assessments every 9 weeks (initially) then 12-24 weeks

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: min(Date of disease progression, Date of death) - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant increase in days compared to placebo (Hazard Ratio 0.69 target)
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): will be defined as the number of days from the date the subject is randomized to the date the subject experiences disease progression per RECIST (version 1.1) and surv

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Overall Survival (OS)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Date of death - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Statistically significant improvement in survival time
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Overall Survival (OS): will be evaluated according to survival information... until the endpoint of death, the subject is lost to follow-up or until the study termination by AbbVie.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Count of subjects with CR + Count of subjects with PR) / Total subjects
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Higher proportion of responders in veliparib arm vs placebo
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Objective Response Rate (ORR)... will be evaluated according to progression per RECIST (version 1.1).

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Count of subjects with CR + PR + SD) / Total subjects
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Higher proportion of subjects with clinical benefit in veliparib arm
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Clinical benefit rate (CBR)... will be evaluated according to progression per RECIST (version 1.1).

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: PFS2

timeWindow.duration: Until second progression or death; monitored at two-month intervals post-study

endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: min(Date of second progression, Date of death) - Date of randomization
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Improvement in time to second progression or death
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: PFS2: will be evaluated according to survival information and post treatment information (includes dates of therapy and response per RECIST 1.1) collected at two-month intervals.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Tertiary: Duration of Overall Response (DOR)
inputs: Date of first objective response (CR or PR)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Date of disease progression - Date of first objective response
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Longer duration of response in veliparib arm
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Duration of Overall Response (DOR): will be evaluated according to progression per RECIST (version 1.1).

derivedVariables.name: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of earliest objective disease progression (per RECIST 1.1) or death from any cause.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Continuous from randomization until event or censoring
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censoring rules per RECIST 1.1 guidelines for subjects without event

derivedVariables.name: Overall Survival (OS)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of death from any cause.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Continuous from randomization until death or censoring
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at the date the subject was last known to be alive

derivedVariables.name: Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) of a specific minimum duration.
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Presence of measurable or non-measurable disease at baseline

derivedVariables.name: Objective Response Rate (ORR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Proportion of subjects with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR).
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Presence of measurable disease at baseline

derivedVariables.name: PFS2
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the date of randomization to the date of second objective disease progression or death from any cause.
derivedVariables.analysisWindow: Continuous from randomization until second event
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censoring rules per protocol for subjects without second event

derivedVariables.name: Duration of Response (DOR)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: The time from the first documented response (CR or PR) to the date of earliest objective disease progression or death.
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Censored at last tumor assessment for subjects without progression

derivedVariables.name: Change in ECOG Performance Status
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Post-baseline ECOG score - Baseline ECOG score
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose of study drug
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) or as specified in SAP

derivedVariables.name: Change in QoL Indices
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Post-baseline QoL score - Baseline QoL score
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose of study drug
derivedVariables.imputationRule: Missing items handled per specific QoL instrument scoring manual

transitions.trigger: Progress to Post Treatment Follow Up

Subjects should have a brain MRI within 28 days of randomization to confirm the absence of CNS metastases. Contrast CT is acceptable for subjects who are unable to undergo a brain MRI. !
